subject: Leadership
title: Ethical Dilemmas in Practice
description: A fast breakdown of Ethical Dilemmas in Practice for builders.

hook.text: Real ethical dilemmas don't have a right answer. They have competing rights. That's what makes them hard.

buildup.text: Kidder's four dilemma types: truth vs. loyalty, individual vs. community, short-term vs. long-term, justice vs. mercy.

discovery.text: Each pits two valid principles against each other. Whistleblowing: truth vs. loyalty. Layoffs: community vs. individual.

twist.text: Leaders who frame ethics as right vs. wrong miss the hard part. The real test is right vs. right.

climax.text: Name the dilemma type. Consult multiple frameworks. Decide transparently. Explain your reasoning even if it's unpopular.

punchline.text: Easy choices don't need ethics. Hard ones do.

quiz.question: What defines a true ethical dilemma according to Kidder?
options: Choosing between two competing right principles
